text: Kevin Mahogany (July 30, 1958 â€“ December 17, 2017) was an American jazz vocalist. He was born in Kansas City, Missouri. His career began in the 1990s. He was known for his scat singing, and his singing style has been compared with jazz singers Joe Williams and Johnny Hartman. His best known work was his album It Don't Mean a Thing (1993) which he performed with Elvis Jones. Mahogany died of heart failure on December 17, 2017 in Kansas City at the age of 59. ==References== ==Other websites== * Kevin Mahogany's official site Category:1958 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American jazz musicians Category:American jazz singers Category:Singers from Kansas City, Missouri Category:Musicians from Kansas City, Missouri
title: Kevin Mahogany
